intro: Zeuxine torricellensis, commonly known as the Torricella zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils in shaded environments. Zeuxine torricellensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
